reminders.title: Morning Remembrance
reminders.text: Start your day with 'Subhanallahi wa bihamdihi' (Glory and praise be to Allah) 100 times. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this 100 times in the morning and evening will not be surpassed on the Day of Judgment by anyone having done better than this except for someone who had said the same or more.'

reminders.title: Eating Etiquette
reminders.text: Remember to eat with your right hand and say 'Bismillah' before eating. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'When one of you eats, he should eat with his right hand and when he drinks, he should drink with his right hand.'

reminders.title: Kindness to Parents
reminders.text: Show kindness to your parents daily. The Prophet ﷺ was asked about the best of deeds, he said: 'Prayer at its proper time, then kindness to parents, then Jihad in the cause of Allah.'

reminders.title: Cleanliness
reminders.text: Maintain cleanliness as it is half of faith. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Cleanliness is half of faith.' Remember to perform wudu properly and maintain physical cleanliness.

reminders.title: Speaking Good
reminders.text: Guard your tongue and speak only good. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.'

reminders.title: Greeting Others
reminders.text: Spread the greeting of Salam. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I tell you something which, if you do it, will make you love one another? Spread the greeting of Salam among you.'

reminders.title: Visiting the Sick
reminders.text: Visit those who are sick. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'When a Muslim visits his sick brother, he is harvesting the fruits of Paradise until he returns.'

reminders.title: Anger Management
reminders.text: Control your anger. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The strong person is not the one who overcomes people by his strength, but the strong is the one who controls himself while in anger.'

reminders.title: Good Treatment of Neighbors
reminders.text: Be good to your neighbors. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should be good to his neighbor.'

reminders.title: Honesty in Business
reminders.text: Be honest in your business dealings. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'The honest, trustworthy merchant will be with the Prophets, the truthful, and the martyrs.'

reminders.title: Care for Orphans
reminders.text: Show kindness to orphans. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'I and the one who looks after an orphan will be like this in Paradise,' and he raised his forefinger and middle finger together.

reminders.title: Prayer Times
reminders.text: Guard your prayers and pray them on time. The Prophet ﷺ was asked: 'Which deed is most beloved to Allah?' He replied: 'Prayer at its proper time.'

reminders.title: Giving Charity
reminders.text: Give charity daily, even if it's little. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Save yourself from the Fire, even with half a date in charity.'

reminders.title: Remembering Death
reminders.text: Remember death often. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Remember frequently the destroyer of pleasures (death).'

reminders.title: Learning Knowledge
reminders.text: Seek beneficial knowledge daily. The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever follows a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise.'
